org.ros.actionlib
Class ActionSpec<T_ACTION extends Message,T_ACTION_FEEDBACK extends Message,T_ACTION_GOAL extends Message,T_ACTION_RESULT extends Message,T_FEEDBACK extends Message,T_GOAL extends Message,T_RESULT extends Message>

java.lang.Object
  org.ros.actionlib.ActionSpec<T_ACTION,T_ACTION_FEEDBACK,T_ACTION_GOAL,T_ACTION_RESULT,T_FEEDBACK,T_GOAL,T_RESULT>
Type Parameters:
T_ACTION - action message
T_ACTION_FEEDBACK - action feedback message
T_ACTION_GOAL - action goal message
T_ACTION_RESULT - action result message
T_FEEDBACK - feedback message
T_GOAL - goal message
T_RESULT - result message
Direct Known Subclasses:
FibonacciActionSpec
public class ActionSpec<T_ACTION extends Message,T_ACTION_FEEDBACK extends Message,T_ACTION_GOAL extends Message,T_ACTION_RESULT extends Message,T_FEEDBACK extends Message,T_GOAL extends Message,T_RESULT extends Message>
extends java.lang.Object

An ActionSpec defines the action on which an action client and action server communicate. It provides methods to create all necessary action messages and extract specific pieces of data from given messages. ActionSpecs are needed as a parameter to instantiate an action client or server. For the user's convenience the ActionSpec class contains methods to build action clients and servers.
Example: 

 {
   @code
   ActionSpec<FibonacciAction, FibonacciActionFeedback, FibonacciActionGoal, FibonacciActionResult, FibonacciFeedback, FibonacciGoal, FibonacciResult> spec;
 
   spec =
       new ActionSpec<FibonacciAction, FibonacciActionFeedback, FibonacciActionGoal, FibonacciActionResult, FibonacciFeedback, FibonacciGoal, FibonacciResult>(
           FibonacciAction.class);
 
   SimpleActionClient<FibonacciActionFeedback, FibonacciActionGoal, FibonacciActionResult, FibonacciFeedback, FibonacciGoal, FibonacciResult> sac =
       spec.createSimpleActionClient("fibonacci");
 }
In order to cut the declaration part short, a specialized ActionSpec can be derived and used (e.g. FibonacciActionSpec, which is part of ROS package 'test_actionlib_java'): 
 {
   @code
   FibonacciActionSpec spec = new FibonacciActionSpec();
   FibonacciSimpleActionClient sac = spec.buildSimpleActionClient("fibonacci");
 }

Constructor Detail

ActionSpec

public ActionSpec(java.lang.Class<T_ACTION> clsAction,
                  java.lang.String actionMessage,
                  java.lang.String actionFeedbackMessage,
                  java.lang.String actionGoalMessage,
                  java.lang.String actionResultMessage,
                  java.lang.String feedbackMessage,
                  java.lang.String goalMessage,
                  java.lang.String resultMessage)
           throws RosException
Constructor. Checks if all needed fields are present in the given action message class object and the referenced sub-messages. If there is something missing, calling most of the methods of this class will result in a NullPointerException. The isValid() method may be used to make sure the ActionSpec was correctly instantiated.

Parameters:
clsAction - The class object of an action message
Throws:
RosException

isValid

public boolean isValid()
Checks, if entailed information is complete in order to use it with an action client/server.

Returns:
true - if this ActionSpec was instantiated correctly
false - otherwise (if that happens, please check if the given class parameters are correct and if their order complies with the class definition.)

buildActionClient

public ActionClient<T_ACTION_FEEDBACK,T_ACTION_GOAL,T_ACTION_RESULT,T_FEEDBACK,T_GOAL,T_RESULT> buildActionClient(java.lang.String nameSpace)
Creates an ActionClient using this ActionSpec and a given nodeName space.

Parameters:
nameSpace - The nodeName space to communicate within (specified by the action server)
Returns:
An ActionClient object

buildSimpleActionClient

public SimpleActionClient<T_ACTION_FEEDBACK,T_ACTION_GOAL,T_ACTION_RESULT,T_FEEDBACK,T_GOAL,T_RESULT> buildSimpleActionClient(java.lang.String nameSpace)
Creates a SimpleActionClient using this ActionSpec and a given nodeName space. The SimpleActionClient gets parameterized to create a new thread to service the callbacks. This spares the users the effort to call spin() or spinOnce() themselves.

Parameters:
nameSpace - The nodeName space to communicate within (specified by the action server)
Returns:
A SimpleActionClient object

buildActionServer

public DefaultActionServer<T_ACTION_FEEDBACK,T_ACTION_GOAL,T_ACTION_RESULT,T_FEEDBACK,T_GOAL,T_RESULT> buildActionServer(java.lang.String nameSpace,
                                                                                                                         ActionServerCallbacks<T_ACTION_FEEDBACK,T_ACTION_GOAL,T_ACTION_RESULT,T_FEEDBACK,T_GOAL,T_RESULT> callbacks)
Creates an DefaultActionServer using this ActionSpec, a given nodeName space and a callback object intended to be used by the server.

Parameters:
nameSpace - The nodeName space to communicate within
callbacks - A callback object providing callback methods, which get called by the server
autoStart - A flag, indicating whether the server shall be immediately started or not
Returns:
An DefaultActionServer object

buildSimpleActionServer

public SimpleActionServer<T_ACTION_FEEDBACK,T_ACTION_GOAL,T_ACTION_RESULT,T_FEEDBACK,T_GOAL,T_RESULT> buildSimpleActionServer(java.lang.String nameSpace,
                                                                                                                              SimpleActionServerCallbacks<T_ACTION_FEEDBACK,T_ACTION_GOAL,T_ACTION_RESULT,T_FEEDBACK,T_GOAL,T_RESULT> callbacks,
                                                                                                                              boolean useBlockingGoalCallback)
Creates a DefaultSimpleActionServer using this ActionSpec, a given nodeName space and a callback object intended to be used by the server. The useBlockingGoalCallback parameter specifies which callback method will be used on the reception of goal messages.

Parameters:
nameSpace - The nodeName space to communicate within
callbacks - A callback object providing callback methods, which get called by the server
useBlockingGoalCallback - A Flag, indicating whether the blocking or non-blocking callback method shall be used
autoStart - A flag, indicating whether the server shall be immediately started or not
Returns:
A DefaultSimpleActionServer object
See Also:
SimpleActionServerCallbacks#blockingGoalCallback(Message), SimpleActionServerCallbacks#goalCallback()
